data.meanings: (Ha-Alif-Lam) To be changed, come in between, pass by.
data.sentence: The word حَوْلَهُ comes from the root ح و ل and is associated with the meanings: (Ha-Alif-Lam) To be changed, come in between, pass by.
The word مِنَ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word هُوَ comes from the root ه و and is associated with the meanings: huwa = He (pronoun. masculine 3rd. sing.)
The word السَّمِيعُ comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.

data.meanings: lowly, humble, submissive, worship, adore, prostrate, make obeisance, lower/bend oneself down towards the ground, lower the head, to salute/honour/magnify, to pay respect, to stand up, to look continuedly and tranquily.MSJD - parts of a man that are the places of SJD, e.g. forehead/nose/hands/knees/feet etc. Any mode/place/practice in which the act of SJD is done.
data.sentence: The word الْمَسْجِدِ comes from the root س ج د and is associated with the meanings: lowly, humble, submissive, worship, adore, prostrate, make obeisance, lower/bend oneself down towards the ground, lower the head, to salute/honour/magnify, to pay respect, to stand up, to look continuedly and tranquily.MSJD - parts of a man that are the places of SJD, e.g. forehead/nose/hands/knees/feet etc. Any mode/place/practice in which the act of SJD is done.

data.meanings: To forbid, prevent, prohibit, make or declare unlawful, deprive, declare a thing sacred.
data.sentence: The word الْحَرَامِ comes from the root ح ر م and is associated with the meanings: To forbid, prevent, prohibit, make or declare unlawful, deprive, declare a thing sacred.

data.meanings: Lying down, kneeling or with legs folded making the chest touch the ground, falling upon the chestTo be or to become firm, steady, steadfast, fixed, continue, remain or stay in placePraying for someone or something, or blessings, felicitations, prospering and abounding in good (e.g. on food, or the saying God bless you)Keeping or applying constantly or persevering in something (e.g. affairs, commerce etc)Extolling God and His attributes, exalting God and/or magnifying GodStriving, laboring and/or exerting oneselfAn ancient name of the monthsA blessing, any good bestowed by God, increase, abundance and/or plenty.
data.sentence: The word بَارَكْنَا comes from the root ب ر ك and is associated with the meanings: Lying down, kneeling or with legs folded making the chest touch the ground, falling upon the chestTo be or to become firm, steady, steadfast, fixed, continue, remain or stay in placePraying for someone or something, or blessings, felicitations, prospering and abounding in good (e.g. on food, or the saying God bless you)Keeping or applying constantly or persevering in something (e.g. affairs, commerce etc)Extolling God and His attributes, exalting God and/or magnifying GodStriving, laboring and/or exerting oneselfAn ancient name of the monthsA blessing, any good bestowed by God, increase, abundance and/or plenty.
The word أَسْرَى comes from the root ا س ر and is associated with the meanings: to make captive, prisoner, joint/ligament/frame/vigour/energy.

data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word لَيْلًا comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)

data.meanings: to swim, roll onwards, perform a daily course, float, the act of swimming, occupy oneself in: the accomplishment of his needful affairs or seeking the means of subsistence, business/occupation, those who are floating, went/travel far, being quick/swift. To praise/glorify/hollow/magnify, sing/celebrate praise, holy, declaring God to be far removed or free for every imperfection/impurity
data.sentence: The word سُبْحَانَ comes from the root س ب ح and is associated with the meanings: to swim, roll onwards, perform a daily course, float, the act of swimming, occupy oneself in: the accomplishment of his needful affairs or seeking the means of subsistence, business/occupation, those who are floating, went/travel far, being quick/swift. To praise/glorify/hollow/magnify, sing/celebrate praise, holy, declaring God to be far removed or free for every imperfection/impurity

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word بِعَبْدِهِ comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.

data.meanings: distant/remote, far, go far away. quswa - more remote, further.
data.sentence: The word الْأَقْصَا comes from the root ق ص و and is associated with the meanings: distant/remote, far, go far away. quswa - more remote, further.

data.meanings: to see/think/hold, in opinion of, perceive, judge, consider, know. ara'itaka / ara'itakum - do tell me thou/you (the personal pronoun Kaf is added for emphasis and is not purely as pleonism without adding to the meaning). tara'ni is for a compound word of a verb tara followed by a pronoun ni - you see me. badi al-ra'yi - having superficial view, outward appearance, first thought, apparently, without proper consideration. ra'yal'ain - to see with naked eye, judgement by sight. ri'yun - outward appearance, make a show. ru'ya - vision dream. a'lam tara - behold! lo! ri'aun - hypocrisy, ostentation, to be seen. tara'a - to see one another, consider, come in sight of one another. yura'una - they deceive hypocritically assuming a false appearance.
data.sentence: The word لِنُرِيَهُ comes from the root ر ا ي and is associated with the meanings: to see/think/hold, in opinion of, perceive, judge, consider, know. ara'itaka / ara'itakum - do tell me thou/you (the personal pronoun Kaf is added for emphasis and is not purely as pleonism without adding to the meaning). tara'ni is for a compound word of a verb tara followed by a pronoun ni - you see me. badi al-ra'yi - having superficial view, outward appearance, first thought, apparently, without proper consideration. ra'yal'ain - to see with naked eye, judgement by sight. ri'yun - outward appearance, make a show. ru'ya - vision dream. a'lam tara - behold! lo! ri'aun - hypocrisy, ostentation, to be seen. tara'a - to see one another, consider, come in sight of one another. yura'una - they deceive hypocritically assuming a false appearance.

data.meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
data.sentence: The word الْبَصِيرُ comes from the root ب ص ر and is associated with the meanings: Becoming perceptive, mental perception, having belief or knowledge, understanding, intelligence or skill, knowing, giving light, shining, illuminated, making manifest, evident and/or apparent.To behold/perceive/see/observe/watch.Opening the eyes and/or seeing (seldom used unless mental perception is conjoined)Clear sightThickness of anythingSense of sight, making or causing to see and/or have sight, eye-sight, eyes.Soft stones having some whitenessIntent or a hard glanceA watcher or guard, a lion.
